  • Method Details

    • usersSize

      public int usersSize()
      Gets the size.
      Returns:
      number of users in the service.

    • getAllUsers

      public List<User> getAllUsers()
      Gets all users in the service.
      Returns:
      a list of all the users.

    • addUser

      public void addUser(String username, String password, String email) throws RepositoryException, ValidationException
      Creates, validates and stores a User.
      Parameters:
      username - - String, can't be null
      password - - String, can't be null
      email - - String, can't be null
      Throws:
      RepositoryException - if the user has already been added.
      ValidationException - if any of the user attributes are empty or if the Password is too short.

    • removeUser

      public void removeUser(String username) throws RepositoryException
      Finds and removes a User and all of its related Friendships.
      Parameters:
      username - - String, can't be null
      Throws:
      RepositoryException - if the user does not exist.

    • getAllFriendships

      public List<Friendship> getAllFriendships()
      Gets all the friendships in the service.
      Returns:
      a list of all the friendships.

    • addFriendship

      public void addFriendship(String username1, String username2) throws RepositoryException
      Creates and stores a Friendship between two Users.
      Parameters:
      username1 - - The first new friend
      username2 - - The second new friend
      Throws:
      RepositoryException - if either of the two users has not been found.

    • removeFriendship

      public void removeFriendship(String username1, String username2) throws RepositoryException
      Removes a friendship.
      Parameters:
      username1 - - The first former friend
      username2 - - The second former friend
      Throws:
      RepositoryException - if either of the two users has not been found.

    • getNumberOfCommunities

      public int getNumberOfCommunities()
      Maps the Network to an undirected graph, so that the number of communities in the Network is equal to the number of connected components in the graph and then computes that number.
      Returns:
      the number of communities.

    • mostSociableCommunity

      public List<User> mostSociableCommunity()
      Gets the most sociable community in the Network (connected component with the longest path)
      Returns:
      a User list containing the Users that make up the most sociable community
